intro: Krynitzkia leucophaea var. alata, commonly known as the silver-leaf krynitzkia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and adaptive features for arid environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a silvery-white underside, which helps reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the winter months. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
